intro: Sanguisorba, commonly known as rosebay willowherb, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their upright growth habit and clusters of small, often pink or red, blossoms. They typically thrive in moist, well-drained soils and are often found in wetlands, meadows, and along stream banks. Sanguisorba species are known for their attractive foliage and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes. The genus includes around 30 species, many of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
